{{cpp/io/basic_streambuf/title|sgetc}}
{{cpp/io/basic_streambuf/navbar}}
{{ddcl | 1=
int_type sgetc();
}}

Reads one character from the input sequence.

If the input sequence read position is not available, returns {{lc|underflow()}}. Otherwise returns {{c|Traits::to_int_type(*gptr())}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
The value of the character pointed to by the ''get pointer''.

===Example===
{{example|
 | code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::stringstream stream("Hello, world");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "sgetc() returned '" &lt;&lt; (char)stream.rdbuf()-&gt;sgetc() &lt;&lt; "'\n";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "peek() returned '" &lt;&lt; (char)stream.peek() &lt;&lt; "'\n";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "get() returned '" &lt;&lt; (char)stream.get() &lt;&lt; "'\n";
}
 | output=
sgetc() returned 'H'
peek() returned 'H'
get() returned 'H'
}}
